revised_title: Preliminary Experiments on a Magnetized Copper Wire and its Effects on Electrical Resistance
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on a copper wire to investigate the effects of magnetization on electrical resistance. They discovered that the first effect of magnetization was an increase in resistance, followed by a decrease in resistance when the magnetism was on. The results suggest that the first effect is related to both the previous treatment of the wire and the application of magnetism.
